Posts.Content: On Mar 09, 2010 5:29 PM suebus wrote: On Feb 24, 2010 5:48 PM Rivergal wrote: On Feb 23, 2010 11:32 PM jpah123 wrote: Hi, I am awaiting my results form a breast biopsy but was told I probable have stage iv breast cancer that has gone to my bones. I currently have a lower back fravture which brought along other tests to see why this happened. My mamagram came out ok but my CAT scan showed suspicion in my breast along with 6-8 places in my spine, ribs, pelvic, etc. I have been reading a lot I want to start on treatment. I have been suffering with my broken bone in my back for 5 months and feel a lot of pain in the places the CAT scan showed disease. Should I start taking Immunopower, Ultramet, Polymvul or is there soething better. I think the doctors will give me a gloomy outlook but I want to start fighting back right now. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated. Hi, Have you been given your diagnosis yet?  Your case sounds very similar to mine, depending on what type of cancer you actually have.  You can click on my profile to read about mine, but the bottom line for me is that having Stage IV LOBULAR breast cancer (which was determined by a biopsy to a couple of my vertibrae) is not such a bad thing, so don't panic.  I was diagnosed in July & thought I wouldn't have much time so I gave away a lot of things that I wish I had kept since I really feel just like I did before I knew I had cancer.... some aches & pains, but mostly just fine.  I have no symptoms at all & have been told I can "live for years" with this disease & that seems to be the way Stage IV lobular breast cancer works because I've heard from others who are the same. If your diagnosis is the same, I can go into more detail as far as treatment goes.  I'll be hoping for the best for you.  Write me....... Toni I also have breast cancer that spread to my liver and bone. I have not started treatment yet I have a vist with the Oncologist onThursday of this week. They are looking into hormone therapy. Posts.Content: On Sep 22, 2011 12:15 AM SpringFlowers wrote: Hi, I have stg4/BC, also in my bones. Dx 2/11, had laser surgery partial mastectomy.  No way I could do the slice and dice and mutilation.  Got fantastic results, clear 2 in margins, no pain, no cutting, no disfigurement.  Scans showed ribs, pelvis and spine tumor, plus nodes in chest, and liver.   I started Zometa and Femara.  Of course told the 2 yr survival, maybe more w/trmt. Well, just had CT scan 6/6/11 - my doc shocked!  No involvment, all tumors disappeared, only one left on my spine and it is reduced 60%.  I've only been on Zometa & Femara 90 days prior to this last scan....but, I take lots of supplements that I feel help...especially the Curcumin/Tumeric and Indole3 with Carbinol, plus lots more....Also, don't give a figs seed what doc's or medical say, I do the Asparagus religiously....Green Giant or Organic canned, bring to boil, puree in blender, cool in ref, take 2 -3 tsps twice day, been doing this 5 mo's., Also take Bicarbonate Soda w/Honey or Maple Syrup (Maple Syrup usage needs cooking, so I use Honey), 1 part Bicarb to 3 parts Honey, 1 Tblsp twice daily.  Who knows, it won't kill me, and something sure worked.   I cannot believe, and neither
